result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber N Knaffla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. Pay supervision fees. Court set restitution at zero.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
Third party contact as approved by the agent for the children.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined by the agent.
Provide DNA Sample.
Defendant has participated in an AODA assessment. If agent feels that another assessment is needed, defendant to participate and comply with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending review on May 20, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber N Knaffla

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amber N Knaffla in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Court will allow that the defendant may have contact at the agent's discretion.

At the request of the agent, case is adjourned for another probation review hearing in Branch 36 on 07/22/2016 at 01:30 p.m.
cab

Defendant Amber N Knaffla in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

As to Count 1: Pursuant to negotiation and on Motion of the State, Count 1 is dismissed and read in for sentencing. 

As to Count 2: 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY as to Count 2.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as to Count 2. Judgment of conviction entered.


Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction consecutive with any other sentence. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 15 months concurrent with any other sentence and with the following conditions:
- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review on May 20, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Defenda thas participated in an AODA assessment. If agent feels that another assessment is needed, defendant to participate and comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined by the agent.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court. Third party contact as approved by the agent for the children.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
-Provide DNA Sample.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.  Probation Review hearing scheduled for May 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Amber N Knaffla in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that this case will resolve and will contact the court for an earlier date if needed.
Defense counsel's request for a modification of the no contact order is denied by the court.
Case remains calendared for a jury trial in Branch 36 on 03/21/2016 at 08:30 a.m.

Defendant Amber N Knaffla in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of his client.

Defense is requesting a final pretrial and jury trial date in branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LMC (D.O.B. 08-17-87)L; and JJK (d.o.b. 05-15-15).
Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons.

Defendant Amber N Knaffla in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KREMERS, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant WITHHELD PLEA UNTIL THE NEXT COURT DATE. Case is adjourned for an Arraingment in Branch 36.  Arraingment scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
